attributes.action: scrap the Regulation of Investigatory Powers Bill (2000)
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The RIP Bill gives law enforcement agencies the right to tap telephone lines, intercept emails, text messages, mobile phone conversations and even search your computer, without a warrant.
This would appear to undermine human rights, and privacy laws, but it is argued that these "conversations" take place in a "public" environment.
Encrypting your data can land you in prison!

This is shocking behaviour in a "free" country, let the people know!!
